headline: Finland Data Center Market Investment Analysis Report 2025-2030 | Major Investments in Helsinki as Finland Targets Carbon Neutrality by 2035
summary: Finland's data center market is forecast to grow at a lucrative CAGR of 53.6% between 2024 and 2030, driven by ideal climatic conditions, government-led carbon neutrality initiatives by 2035, and increasing data center facilities in cities like Helsinki and Espoo. Leveraging natural free cooling and advanced district heating networks, Finland sees low-carbon energy sourcing, with renewables forming 40-48% of its energy mix. headline: Sweden Data Center Colocation Market Report 2025-2030 | Existing & Upcoming White-Floor Space, IT Load Capacity, and Colocation Pricing for 37 Existing and 8 Upcoming Facilities Across 6+ States
summary: Sweden's data center colocation market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 25.88% from 2024 to 2030, driven by increasing demand and sustainability developments. The market analysis covers utilized white floor area, IT power capacity, and racks, with detailed insights on colocation investments and future trends. Key existing operators include atNorth, EcoDataCenter, and Equinix, with new entrants like evroc and STORESPEED. The report addresses growth prospects, market competition, and the evolving

headline: Ireland Data Center Market Report 2025-2030 | Ireland's National Broadband Plan Targets 420,000 Premises by 2025
summary: Ireland's data center market is poised for significant growth, with a forecasted CAGR of 9.79% from 2024 to 2030. Key drivers include a surge in cloud computing demand and AI usage, with over 15% of enterprises leveraging AI in 2024. Notable developments include OVH Cloud's 2025 launch of an edge zone in Dublin and Echelon's wind-powered data centers. Government initiatives like the National Broadband Plan aim to enhance connectivity and digital skills, targeting 80% digital literacy by 2030. Ke

headline: Equinix Appoints Arquelle Shaw as President, Americas
summary: Equinix, Inc. (Nasdaq: EQIX), the world's digital infrastructure company®, has appointed Equinix veteran Arquelle Shaw as President, Americas, effective immediately. In this role, Arquelle is responsible for the management, strategy and growth of Equinix in the Americas region, shortening the path for customers and partners to harness digital innovation and global connectivity in today's fast-changing technology landscape.

content.title: Equinix Appoints Arquelle Shaw as President, Americas
